storyInfo: Mitm's newspaper agency fails to get off the ground, but he manages to get himself a printer. Now he just needs a typesetter who can read.

attributes.content: Sure and steady, you hear me?
attributes.name: Questionable Man

attributes.content: This is your last chance before I kick you outta here.
attributes.name: Questionable Man

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Dejected Man

attributes.content: That's right, slow and steadyâ€”
attributes.name: Questionable Man

attributes.content: ...Ahh!
attributes.name: Dejected Man

attributes.content: I told you to be sure and steady! Now you've gone and ruined another one.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Just copy the pattern on the wax paper. It's not that hard.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I didn't mean to ruin it, Consultant. It's just, the scribblings are all weird and complicated...
attributes.name: Dejected Man

attributes.content: Those are words. It says, 'Get 20% off with this coupon.'
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I know those are words, and I know you're printing coupons, but like I told you, I can't read...
attributes.name: Dejected Man
Pohl
attributes.content: Alright, fine, never mind.

attributes.name: Pohl
attributes.content: But forget about your wages. You're lucky I'm not asking you to pay for all the ruined wax paper.
attributes.joined: Alright, fine, never mind. But forget about your wages. You're lucky I'm not asking you to pay for all the ruined wax paper.

attributes.content: *Sarkaz expletive*, why don't you do it yourself?
attributes.name: Dejected Man

attributes.content: Because I've got a bunch of other things to do, and I don't have the time to fiddle with wax paperâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Consultant! There's another gang fight out there!
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: See?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: ...Fine.
attributes.name: Dejected Man

attributes.content: Well, you wasted all my wax paper, but I guess you put in the work. You can grab a couple of potatoes from that sack over there. Can't have people calling me a miser.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Really? Thanks, Consultant!
attributes.name: Dejected Man

attributes.content: Who's fighting who this time, Liz?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Over a few damn rocks again? I've practically memorized a script for breaking up fights now.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Say, Liz, want to try your hand at etching wax paper?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I thought you ran out.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Well, I just remembered I actually had an extra pack lying around.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: A likely story. Anyway, I'm not doing it. Words make my head hurt.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: But I'm curious. Why did you get a printer when you knew you couldn't afford to found a newspaper?
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Okay, don't tell anyone. You know the food trader asked us to print some coupons, right? Four pieces of scrap metal for one bag of potatoes.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You want to print extra coupons?
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Only a moron would ruin his own reputation like that.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: He's printing this because scrap metal is in short supply, and he has a basement full of potatoes. What we're printing, though, is not 'scrap metal for potatoes', but '20% off'.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I see... you want to trade with other stuff? Maybe wood? We've got plenty of that lying around.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Depends on the current prices.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You always see further than anyone else.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: I see so far ahead that I forgot nobody here can write.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Speaking of which, I hear a reading class just opened.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Reading class? Oh, you mean that merc. Doesn't look like somebody you'd wanna mess with. Might think about it, if one of his students strikes out on their own.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Fat chance. It's all kids even younger than me. He probably has his hands full just keeping them in their seats.
attributes.name: Clever Girl
Pohl
attributes.content: Kids? Doesn't sound like he's trying to make a living out of it...

attributes.name: Pohl
attributes.content: So why did he start the class at all?
attributes.joined: Kids? Doesn't sound like he's trying to make a living out of it... So why did he start the class at all?

attributes.content: Out of some big dreams, maybe? I've got a relative whose kid goes there. He says the teacher talks about Kazdelian culture, our future, stuff like that.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Great, now I'm sure we won't get along.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Well, you can start etching your wax paper right away. Plenty of work for one person.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Hey, I was joking. I'm not about to let someone like that slip through my fingers.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Ooh, getting serious, aren't we?
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: So, what's the plan, Consultant?
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Quiet, I'm thinking.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Is Mr. Hoederer in?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Hi there, Mr. Hoederer. My name's Pohl, and I live around here.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Pohl looks around the room. The only notable feature is a blackboard with a few basic sentences written on it, plus some children's scribblings on the side.
There are also a few old, tattered books.
Seeing this, Pohl is even more certain that he has the right plan for talking to the guy.
He rubs his hands and deliberately avoids looking into Hoederer's eyes.
I apologize for the abrupt visit, but I...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I have a dream.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Pohl chooses to look to Hoederer's face after this statement. However, he reads no notable emotion upon it.
Not much of a surprise. People willing to do things like this tend to be a little eccentric. Perhaps he is just not the talkative type.
I've heard that you have the same dream. You're teaching the next generation of Kazdel to read, right?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: That's my dream too. A Kazdel where everyone can read.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Honestly, you're one step ahead of me. You're doing great work here.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Teaching some wild kids in a tiny room like this... you are a dreamer, sir, and I respect you for that.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Sarkaz culture has been lost to us for too long. Kazdel has to learn the importance of writing, culture, and civilization again. And it all starts with education.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: All you have, though, is one little classroom. Pretty easy to fail here.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Word of mouth can get distorted, disappear. That's why I cobbled together a printer.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: (His eyes lit up! This is gonna work.)
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Think about it. It takes seconds to print what takes you an hour to say, and you can reach more people this way. That's what you should be aiming for.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: So I came to you. To ask you to spare some time to help with etching wax paper for my type, to give your dream a leg up.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I'd do it myself, but there are other things that need my attentionâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You can read?
attributes.name: Hoederer
Pohl
attributes.content: Yes, the work needs reading...

attributes.name: Pohl
attributes.content: Wait, that's not what I meant, I meanâ€”
attributes.joined: Yes, the work needs reading... Wait, that's not what I meant, I meanâ€”

attributes.content: In order to read... no, we were talking about wax paper...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Wax paper... wax paperâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Wait, what was you question?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You asked me if I could read?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Er, yes, I can.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Who taught you to read? Your parents? A teacher? Are they still in Kazdel?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...I taught myself.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You're self-taught? That's impressive. I haven't met a literate Sarkaz in these parts for a long time.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...Same here.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I mean, I'm just as happy to meet you, Mr. Hoederer.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Back on topic, I wanted to ask you to help contribute to a Kazdel where everyone can read. Your classroom is an achievement, of course, butâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You said you built a printer? What are you printing?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Just stuff I think is useful, brochures, local newsâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Can anybody else read them?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Ughâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: That's certainly an issue. And it's why I print other things, discount coupons for example. Don't need to be able to read, as long as the food trader has a sample to refer to.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It's not exactly in line with my vision, but that's all I can do on my own, which is why I came to youâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: On the contrary, there's a great deal of power in words that can be traded for food.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...Power?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Well, talking to you sure is enlightening, Mr. Hoederer. Now, about the wax paper...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I'll go when I have time.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Well, a little etching here and there wouldn't quite be enough. I truly want to make this a real print shop. Could we set a more regular time? Like a few afternoons each week?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I have other business besides the literacy class. I can't offer you too much time.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Well, if you'll pardon my frankness... we must all make sacrifices for our dreams.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: ...Of course.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: And, a dream is not something measured so simply in terms of time, is it?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: All the gangs around here know I can read, so they come to me whenever they need something read or calculated, like figuring out who gains money and who loses...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Yet I've squeezed out the time to open this print shop. Sure, it cuts into my leisure, but...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: (No... that won't work. Seems like he's for-real busy.)
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Perhaps you could let me know what's eating up your time? I might be able to help you deal with it.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: (Wry smile) Thanks, but no thanks.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: (No, I can't back off now. At least...)
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: (Sorry, Mr. Hoederer.)
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: We're really shorthanded. If you couldn't help... I'm afraid this print shop venture has to come to an end...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I'm really at my wits' end, and I don't want the printer to go to waste. If even you can't help me...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: So you need a typesetter right now, no matter what?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Yes. If you really can't spare the time, maybe we can find another solution together? I've spent all my savings on the printer.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You know what the gangs are like. I end up owing them money, after all I've done for them. Never mind the printer; I'll be out of a place to live if I can't keep this running.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Mr. Hoederer?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: How about this.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hoederer turns around and goes to a corner of the room. His tall frame obscures what he is doing.
Pohl feels his heart race.
What is he getting? A letter? An address? Perhaps... a weapon?
Couldn't possibly be moneyâ€”
Here, this money should last a while. Just pay me back when you're able, take your time.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I know that paying with money in Kazdel isn't easy, but it should be enough to pay the gangs off.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Use the rest of it to hire someone, teach them to read and write, so there'll be another literate person in these parts.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: No, I mean, yes, I could do that, but this money is...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I saved it together with someone. I didn't touch her part. This is all coming from my share.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But... aren't you worried that I'll just take the money andâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: (Bite your tongue, Pohl! There's cash right in front of you!)
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Guess I'll... take it?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Take it.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Pohl stands dumbfounded with the money in his hand. Hoederer steps to his side and bends down to pat his shoulder.
How old are you, kid?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It's alright if you don't want to say.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You taught yourself to read and write. I was just thinking about that.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: No parent, no teacher. What kind of life drove a Kazdelian kid to learn to read and write on his own?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Go home now. And I want a copy of whatever you print, once you find your typesetter.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Mr. Hoederer, Iâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: No, forget it.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You're back, Consultant! How did it go with the merc?
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: What's with the face? If he said no, he said no.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: He... didn't say no.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Even better!
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: It's not like that. Heâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: What is it? You're not acting like yourself. Did he hit you or something?
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Did he have a bunch of books that even you couldn't read?
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: No, that's notâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: â€”Oh yeah, books.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Give me a hand, Liz.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I said I'm not helping with the wax paper.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: I'll take care of the paper. There's a sliding door under my bed. Inside is a wooden box.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Wow, I didn't know you had a hiding spot like this! What's in it? Jewels? Pure Gold? A Sankta gun?
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: You'll know when you see it. Just grab it for me while I check the printer.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Wow, this is heavy. What the heck is in it?
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Here's the key, open it up. I've got ink all over my hands.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Well, guess I should be glad that you trust me.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: What's with all the old books?
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Oh, I thought this was Mr. Hoederer's home...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It's for you.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Pohl? Come in.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Here, Mr. Hoederer.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: ...Printouts?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I printed a few books I used when I learned to read. They might be useful for your literacy class.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: From a decade ago?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Thanks. This will work nicely once the children have progressed a little further. Let me see... mercenary diaries, propaganda pamphlets from the Military Commission during the Leithanian invasion...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You've got all sorts of stuff here. This looks like a manuscript from around 1030.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Is it valuable? I'll bring the original, if you need it.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: No, the copy will do just fine. How much?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I couldn't possibly ask you for more money! I can't even spend everything you gave me, even after paying back the gangs.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Here's half back.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Pohlâ€”
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Here.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Don't worry about the other half. I'll pay it back in a few months, with 10% interest.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Ha. I'm sure we can cut the interest out?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Don't look at me. It's your money.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: In that case... could you make a printout of this map, Pohl?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Of course. Anything else?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Let me think...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Test papers for the kids, maybe?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The wax paper's done, Consultant.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Mm... not bad. You're almost ready to get to work.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: But I didn't understand half of what's on it.
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: Don't worry, I wasn't much better when I started learning. Want some potatoes?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Yeah!
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: ...With sugar? Wow!
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: You're my only typesetter. Got to make sure you're happy and well-fedâ€”
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: We had an agreement with them to split forty-sixty, but now they want fifty-fifty! You tell them they're greedy slugs, Consultant!
attributes.name: Angry Gang Leader

attributes.content: Greedy slugs? Our guys bled for this!
attributes.name: Brooding Gang Leader

attributes.content: Not again...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It's always the same with these people, isn't it?
attributes.name: Clever Girl

attributes.content: What did you say?!
attributes.name: Gang Leaders

attributes.content: Don't mind her, she's just a kid.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Anyway, this is simple.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Pohl takes out a printed sheet and slams it down on the table.
Here's your agreement. I have the hand-written original with palm-prints, and both of you have a copy.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Let me see... 'the profits shall be split 40-60...'
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: See? Written in black and white!
attributes.name: Angry Gang Leader

attributes.content: 'In the event of any casualties, the side with fewer casualties shall relinquish part of their share, up to a 50-50 split...'
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Now THAT is black and white!
attributes.name: Brooding Gang Leader

attributes.content: *Sarkaz expletive*, you're not playing me for a fool, are you?
attributes.name: Angry Gang Leader

attributes.content: You're the only one who can read here! How do I know you didn't print this just to fool us? How do we know you're not full of shit?
attributes.name: Angry Gang Leader

attributes.content: Pohl grins and points at the door.
Why not learn to read and check for yourself?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: There's a merc who teaches reading classes over there. I hear he's still taking new students.
attributes.name: Pohl
